resources.string: As Per Section 62 on income tax ordinance (For Mutual Funds)
As Per Section 63 on income tax ordinance (For Pension Funds)
What is your Annual Taxable Income?

Home-Building/ Buying/ Improvements
 Higher Education of Children
 Marriage of children
 Hajj/ Umrah/ Travel / Vacation planning
 Healthcare expense in old-age
 Living expense in old-age
How many years from now will you require this amount?
Do you have any current savings that you intend to invest?(Pak Rupees)
How much do you intend to invest in NAFA Funds on Monthly basis?
Your Desired Rate of Return?(% per Year)
Do you have any current savings that you intend to invest? (Pak Rupees)
What is your age at the time of joining NAFA Pension Fund?
What is your per month gross salary including all benefits at time of joining NAFA Pension Fund?
What is your expected average Salary Increment in your working years?(%)
At what age do you expect to retire?
Please check if you want to invest only up to taxable amount
NAFA Pension Fund, would you intent to transfer to Income Payment Plan?(%)

At Retirement Age, Participants are allowed to withdraw 50% of their accumulated balance in NAFA Pension Fund without paying any tax. For remaining or whole they can choose to
 a)Enroll in an Income Payment Plan
 b)Buy an annuity
 c)Withdraw while paying the applicable tax
